episodeTitle: Morgan versus Luffy! Who's the Mysterious Pretty Girl?
episodeTitleJapanese: モーガンVSルフィ！謎の美少女は誰？
episodeTitleRomanized: Mōgan tai Rufi! Nazo no Bishōjo wa Dare?
description: Luffy and Zoro battle Captain Morgan and defeat him, freeing Shells Town from his tyranny. Koby joins the Marines while Zoro officially becomes the first member of Luffy's pirate crew. Meanwhile, Nami continues searching for Grand Line maps.

events.title: Luffy Returns Zoro's Swords
events.description: Following the events of the previous episode, Luffy returns Zoro's three katanas to him. Zoro takes his swords and prepares to fight against the Marines who have surrounded them in the courtyard.
events.significance: This moment marks the beginning of Zoro's active partnership with Luffy and sets up his first major battle in the series.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy returns Zoro's katanas to him

events.title: Zoro's Three Sword Style Debut
events.description: Zoro uses his Three Sword Style (Santoryu) technique for the first time in the anime, wielding one katana in each hand and holding the Wado Ichimonji in his mouth. He cuts through his ropes and prepares to battle the Marines.
events.significance: This is the iconic debut of Zoro's signature fighting style that becomes his trademark throughout the entire series. The Three Sword Style represents Zoro's unique approach to swordsmanship and his promise to Kuina.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro announces his fighting style for the first time

events.title: Battle Against the Marines Begins
events.description: Luffy and Zoro engage in battle against Captain Morgan's Marine forces in the courtyard of the Shells Town Marine base. The Marines attack with rifles and swords but are quickly overwhelmed by the duo's abilities.
events.significance: First coordinated battle between Luffy and Zoro, establishing their combat synergy and setting up their future partnership.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Muchi Debut
events.description: Luffy demonstrates a new Devil Fruit technique called Gomu Gomu no Muchi (Gum-Gum Whip), stretching his leg and swinging it in a wide arc to strike multiple Marine soldiers at once.
events.significance: Expands Luffy's arsenal of rubber-based attacks, showing the versatility of the Gomu Gomu no Mi powers beyond just punching.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy uses his whip attack for the first time

events.title: Morgan Enters the Battle
events.description: Captain 'Axe-Hand' Morgan personally joins the battle, wielding his signature axe-blade that replaces his right hand. He orders his men to continue attacking despite being clearly overpowered by Luffy's Devil Fruit abilities and Zoro's swordsmanship.
events.significance: Establishes Morgan as a direct physical threat and showcases his tyrannical leadership style and willingness to sacrifice his own men.

quotes.speaker: Morgan
quotes.context: Morgan orders his Marines to continue fighting despite the odds

events.title: Helmeppo Takes Koby Hostage
events.description: Realizing they are losing the battle, the cowardly Helmeppo grabs Koby and holds a gun to his head, threatening to shoot him unless Luffy and Zoro surrender. Koby is terrified but tries to remain brave.
events.significance: Demonstrates Helmeppo's cowardice and willingness to use others as shields. Tests Luffy's resolve and trust in his friends.

quotes.text: Stop right there or I'll shoot him!
quotes.speaker: Helmeppo
quotes.context: Helmeppo threatens Koby's life to stop Luffy and Zoro

events.title: Morgan Attempts to Attack Distracted Luffy
events.description: While Luffy is distracted by Helmeppo's hostage situation, Morgan sees an opportunity and attempts to strike Luffy from behind with his axe-hand. This shows Morgan's dishonorable fighting tactics.
events.significance: Reveals Morgan's lack of honor and willingness to use underhanded tactics, contrasting with Luffy's straightforward approach.

events.title: Luffy Punches Helmeppo and Zoro Defeats Morgan
events.description: Luffy stretches his arm and punches Helmeppo in the face, freeing Koby from danger. Simultaneously, Zoro intercepts Morgan's sneak attack and cuts him down with his swords, defeating the tyrannical Marine captain.
events.significance: Marks the conclusive defeat of the Romance Dawn Arc's main antagonist and demonstrates the trust and coordination between Luffy and Zoro. This victory liberates Shells Town from Morgan's oppressive rule.

events.title: Marines Arrest Their Own Captain
events.description: After Morgan's defeat, the Marines who have long suffered under his tyrannical rule decide to arrest their own captain rather than continue following his orders. They dishonorably discharge him and take him into custody.
events.significance: Shows that not all Marines are corrupt and that justice can come from within the organization. Sets up the theme that individual character matters more than organizational affiliation.

events.title: Zoro Officially Joins Luffy's Crew
events.description: Following the battle's conclusion and his promise from the previous episode, Roronoa Zoro officially agrees to join Monkey D. Luffy's pirate crew as his first crew member. This marks the true beginning of the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: One of the most important moments in One Piece history - the recruitment of the first Straw Hat crew member. Zoro becomes Luffy's right-hand man and establishes the pattern of Luffy recruiting powerful allies who share his values.

quotes.text: Alright, I'll join your crew. But if you ever get in the way of my dream, I'll make you commit seppuku!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro agrees to join Luffy's crew with conditions

events.title: Victory Celebration at Ririka's Restaurant
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Koby are treated to a celebratory meal at Ririka's restaurant (the local bar in the anime). The townspeople of Shells Town express their gratitude for being freed from Morgan's tyranny. Rika and her mother Ririka thank them personally.
events.significance: Establishes the pattern of Luffy being celebrated by the people he helps, showing the positive impact of his actions despite being a pirate.

events.title: Koby Explains World Geography and the Grand Line
events.description: During the meal, Koby explains the geography of the One Piece world to Luffy and Zoro. He describes how the world is divided into East and West by a continent called the Red Line, and that the Grand Line is a linear sea perpendicular to the Red Line. He also explains that Gol D. Roger claimed to have hidden his treasure at the very end of the Grand Line.
events.significance: Critical world-building moment that establishes the geography of the One Piece world and clarifies the goal of reaching the end of the Grand Line. This explanation helps viewers understand the scale and challenge of Luffy's journey.

quotes.text: The world is divided by the Red Line, and the Grand Line runs perpendicular to it. That's where the One Piece is!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby explains world geography to Luffy and Zoro

events.title: Ripper Becomes New Base Commander
events.description: A Marine officer named Ripper, who served under Morgan, becomes the new commander of the 153rd Branch Marine base in Shells Town. He demonstrates a much more reasonable and just approach to leadership compared to Morgan.
events.significance: Introduces Ripper as a minor character and shows the immediate positive change in Shells Town's Marine leadership.

events.title: Koby Joins the Marines
events.description: Koby approaches Ripper and formally requests to join the Marines. Ripper accepts his request, allowing Koby to begin pursuing his dream of becoming a Marine officer. This marks the divergence of Koby's path from Luffy's.
events.significance: Fulfills Koby's character arc from the Romance Dawn Arc, showing him gaining the courage to pursue his dream. Establishes the theme that Luffy inspires others to chase their ambitions, even when those paths separate.

quotes.text: I want to join the Marines!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby formally requests to join the Marines

events.title: Luffy and Zoro Ordered to Leave Town
events.description: Despite being grateful for their help, Ripper informs Luffy and Zoro that due to their status as pirates, they must leave Shells Town. He promises not to report them to Marine headquarters as a gesture of gratitude, but they cannot remain in the town.
events.significance: Establishes the paradox of Luffy's existence - he helps people but is still considered a criminal. Shows the institutional conflict between the Marines and pirates regardless of individual actions.

events.title: Emotional Farewell Between Luffy and Koby
events.description: As Luffy and Zoro prepare to depart by boat, Koby comes to the dock to see them off. There is an emotional moment where Koby thanks Luffy for inspiring him to pursue his dream and giving him the courage to change his life. They part as friends on different paths.
events.significance: Concludes the emotional arc between Luffy and Koby that began in episode 1. Reinforces the theme of friendship transcending opposing sides and dreams taking people on different journeys.

quotes.text: Thank you, Luffy! I'll never forget what you did for me!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby thanks Luffy before they part ways

events.title: Luffy and Zoro Depart Shells Town
events.description: Luffy and Zoro sail away from Shells Town in a small boat, continuing their journey. The townspeople and Marines watch them leave, with many saluting in respect despite their pirate status.
events.significance: Concludes the Romance Dawn Arc and transitions to the next stage of Luffy's journey with his first crew member.

events.title: Nami Searches for Grand Line Maps
events.description: In a brief scene, Nami is shown searching for maps of the Grand Line. She discovers that a pirate named Buggy has stolen a map she needs. This sets up the next arc.
events.significance: Foreshadows the Buggy arc and continues to build mystery around Nami's character and her obsession with maps and treasure.

quotes.speaker: Zoro

quotes.text: The world is divided by the Red Line, and the Grand Line runs perpendicular to it. That's where the One Piece is!
quotes.speaker: Koby

quotes.speaker: Koby

themes.description: The episode explores how true justice sometimes requires standing against corrupt authority. The Marines themselves arrest Morgan, showing that institutional loyalty shouldn't override moral responsibility.
themes.symbolism: Morgan's axe-hand represents oppressive authority that must be cut down. His defeat by combined forces shows that unity against tyranny prevails.

themes.description: Luffy and Koby, who became friends through their shared determination to pursue their dreams, must now part ways as their paths lead in opposite directions - one becoming a pirate, the other a Marine.
themes.symbolism: The dock where they part represents the fork in the road where friends separate but carry each other's inspiration forward.

themes.description: Zoro joining Luffy establishes the foundation of the Straw Hat crew and the concept of nakama (crewmate/comrade). Their partnership in battle shows the beginning of the crew's coordination and trust.
themes.symbolism: Zoro's three swords represent his strength and individuality that he brings to the crew, while his agreement to join represents the bonds that will form.

themes.description: The contrast between Helmeppo's cowardice and Koby's growing courage demonstrates the difference between being born into power versus earning it through determination.
themes.symbolism: Helmeppo hiding behind hostages versus Koby standing tall to join the Marines shows the difference between false and true strength.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates his Three Sword Style for the first time and officially joins Luffy's crew, fulfilling his promise from episode 2. He proves his strength by defeating Morgan and protecting Luffy.

Uses Three Sword Style for the first time

keyActions: Uses Gomu Gomu no Muchi for the first time
Recruits Zoro as first crew member

characterSpotlights.development: Koby completes his character arc by officially joining the Marines, fulfilling the dream he revealed in episode 1. He shows growth from the terrified cabin boy to someone ready to pursue his ambitions.
keyActions: Formally requests to join the Marines

characterSpotlights.development: Morgan is revealed as a corrupt and tyrannical Marine officer who is ultimately defeated and arrested by his own subordinates after losing to Luffy and Zoro.
keyActions: Joins the battle with his axe-hand

characterSpotlights.development: Helmeppo demonstrates complete cowardice by taking Koby hostage when the battle turns against them. He is easily defeated by Luffy.

mangaDifferences.difference: Ririka is portrayed as a bartender running a bar in the anime, but in the manga she is a home cook who invites them to her house.
The manga version includes Morgan ordering his soldiers to kill themselves as punishment, which was omitted from the anime.
The departure scene has more townspeople visible in the manga version compared to the anime.
The anime expands the celebration scene and world geography explanation compared to the manga's briefer treatment.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the final episode of the Romance Dawn Arc, concluding the opening story that introduces the main premise of One Piece.
Episode 3 was the first to feature the 'To Be Continued' screen before the ending theme, which became a series staple.
The eyecatcher themes in this episode play opposite their associated characters, with Zoro's theme playing during Luffy's eyecatcher and vice versa.
This episode achieved a 13.3% viewership rating when it originally aired in Japan on November 24, 1999, ranking #7 for that week.
Kazuya Nakai, who voices Zoro, has continued in the role for over 25 years, making him one of the longest-running voice actors in the series.
Zoro joining Luffy's crew establishes the pattern that would continue throughout the series of Luffy recruiting crew members who initially had no intention of becoming pirates.
